TopicTitle: My RSS trip to the Moon that quite nearly ended in disaster

Articles.Content:
Nearly ended in disaster quite a few times, I must say.

Who know 20km/s dV was barely enough without orbital rendezvous around the moon?

Poor planning and bad piloting led to the hilarity that ensued:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I lost some fins when SRBs decoupled, Lost my solar panels so MJ didn't work after I toppled over on the moon, nearly ran out of fuel. An all around eventful kerbal day in the utmost of kerbal ways.

A quick trip to the moon ended up taking 110 days... sorry Kerbonauts.

That's probably why NASA didn't use Direct Ascent.

I bet that was a scary -yet funny- mission to do!
It took you nearly a quarter year to get to the moon and back. wat

Dem texture reductionz tho.

Nice build anyways!

It took you nearly a quarter year to get to the moon and back. wat

Well, that may be because he departed on the wrong side with little delta v and had to look for a good gravity assist window he could afford.

Edited March 20, 2014 by KvickFlygarn87
